column4: hi there, is there a way i could login as root? (linux nub here)
do not login as root if you don't know what you're doing
ubuntu has put a lot of effort into the sudo security model
then you don't need to be root, as the file is owned by you
don't use sudo -s to create files
then the permissions will always be the users
you should never create files in /
what are you trying to edit
can you please show me the URL you are following
ok, so the line that says 10.04 does not support java 5 is not alarming to you
that guide is telling you to add repo's from an old ubuntu version (totally unsupported with 10.04)
I would strongly advis eyou not to add that line if you want to keep your system usable
no idea, but that guide is giving out dangerous information
